text: The 250 metres event at the 1926 Women's World Games was the first and only time a 250 metres was held at Women's World Games. The event took place in Gothenburg at the Slottsskogsvallen during the first day of the Games on 27 August 1926. At the 1922 Women's World Games a 300 metres event was held. At the 1930 Women's World Games the 250 metres was replaced by the 200 metres event. British Eileen Edwards won the final in a new world record of 23.4 seconds. Her running style is described as fantastic. Behind her the British Vera Palmer finished second and French Marguerite Radideau third in a new French national record. ==Results== ===Heats=== The first two athletes of each heat continued to the final ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marguerite Radideau 34.0 Q 2 Julia Chmizowska Q 3 ? ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Eileen Edwards Q 2 Yolande Plancke Q 3 ? ====Heat 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Vera Palmer Q 2 Kinue Hitomi Q 3 ? Source: ====Heat unknown==== Polish finished third in on of the heats with a time of 36.6. ===Final=== Rank Name Nationality Time (s) Notes Eileen Edwards 33.4 WR Vera Palmer 34.6 Marguerite Radideau 35.4 NR 4 Yolande Plancke 35.8 5 Julia Chmizowska 36.4 6 Kinue Hitomi 37 Source: ==References== Category:1926 Women's World Games
